alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Ector; Glasscock; Midland; Mitchell; Reeves County Plains; Scurry; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 18 at 9:49PM CDT until April 19 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM CDT /8 AM MDT/ TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ WEDNESDAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO AND MUCH OF WEST TEXAS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20 FT WINDS OF 20 MPH OR MORE, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER... * AFFECTED AREA...Scurry, Mitchell, Ector, Midland, Glasscock, Ward, Reeves County Plains, Davis Mountains and Davis Mountains Foothills. * TIMING...From 9 AM to 9 PM CDT Wednesday. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent. * RFTI...5 or critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow quickly into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Ector; Glasscock; Midland; Mitchell; Reeves County Plains; Scurry; Ward
